variables.name: meta2_container_max_size
variables.descr: How many bytes may be stored in each container.

variables.name: meta2_retention_period
variables.descr: How long should deleted content be kept.

variables.name: meta2_batch_maxlen
variables.descr: When listing a container, limits the number of items to that value.

variables.name: meta2_reload_lb_period
variables.descr: Sets the period of the periodical reloading of the Load-balancing state, in the current meta2 service.

variables.name: meta2_reload_nsinfo_period
variables.descr: Sets the period of the periodical reloading of the namespace configuration, in the current meta2 service.

variables.name: meta2_flag_precheck_on_generate
variables.descr: Should the meta2 check the container state (quota, etc) before generating chunks.

variables.name: meta2_flag_delete_exceeding_versions
variables.descr: When adding alias with versioning, deletes exceeding versions.

variables.name: meta2_flush_limit
variables.descr: When flushing a container, limits the number of deleted objects.

variables.name: meta2_flag_store_chunk_ids
variables.descr: Should the meta2 store complete chunk IDs (URL) or just store service IDs. If this is set to false, core.lb.generate_random_chunk_ids should be set to false also.

variables.name: oio_rawx_events
variables.descr: Is the RAWX allowed to emit events in the beansatlkd?

variables.name: oio_rawx_allow_slash
variables.descr: Is the RAWX allowed to run if its base directory is hosted in the root partition, a.k.a. '/'.

variables.name: oio_events_common_buffer_delay
variables.descr: Sets the buffering delay of the events emitted by the application

variables.name: oio_events_common_max_pending
variables.descr: Sets the maximum number of pending events, not received yet by the endpoint

variables.name: oio_events_zmq_max_recv
variables.descr: Sets the maximum number of ACK managed by the ZMQ notification client

variables.name: oio_events_beanstalkd_timeout
variables.descr: Set the interval between each check of the beanstalkd availability. Set to 0 to never check.

variables.name: oio_events_beanstalkd_check_period
variables.descr: Set the interval between each check of the beanstalkd availability. Set to 0 to never check.

variables.name: oio_events_beanstalkd_check_level_deny
variables.descr: Set the maximum number of items in beanstalkd before considering it full

variables.name: oio_events_beanstalkd_check_level_alert
variables.descr: Set a threshold for the number of items in the beanstalkd, so that the service will alert past that value. Set to 0 for no alert sent.

variables.name: oio_events_beanstalkd_default_prio
variables.descr: Sets the priority of each notification sent to the BEANSTALK endpoint

variables.name: oio_events_beanstalkd_default_delay
variables.descr: Sets the delay on each notification sent to the BEANSTALK endpoint

variables.name: oio_events_beanstalkd_default_ttr
variables.descr: Sets the TTR (time to run) allow on the treatment of the notificatio sent to the beanstalkd

variables.name: oio_resolver_cache_enabled
variables.descr: Allows the resolver instances to cache entries

variables.name: oio_resolver_m0cs_default_ttl
variables.descr: In any service resolver instanciated, sets the default TTL on the entries related meta0 (meta1 addresses) and conscience (meta0 address)

variables.name: oio_resolver_m0cs_default_max
variables.descr: In any service resolver instanciated, sets the maximum number of entries related to meta0 (meta1 addresses) and conscience (meta0 address)

variables.name: oio_resolver_srv_default_ttl
variables.descr: In any service resolver instanciated, sets the default TTL on the meta1 entries (data-bound services)

variables.name: oio_resolver_srv_default_max
variables.descr: In any service resolver instanciated, sets the maximum number of meta1 entries (data-bound services)

variables.name: oio_volume_lock_lazy
variables.descr: Allow the services to self-assign to the volume they find in their configuration. This was the default behaviour in pre 5.2 versions of oio-sds.

variables.name: oio_socket_gridd_rcvbuf
variables.descr: Set to a non-zero value to explicitely force a RCVBUF option on client sockets to gridd services. Set to 0 to keep the OS default.

variables.name: oio_socket_gridd_sndbuf
variables.descr: Set to a non-zero value to explicitely force a SNDBUF option on client sockets to gridd services. Set to 0 to keep the OS default.

variables.name: oio_ns_meta1_digits
variables.descr: Default number of digits to agregate meta1 databases.

variables.name: oio_ns_flat_bits
variables.descr: Default number of bits with flat-NS computation.

variables.name: oio_ns_chunk_size
variables.descr: Default chunk size for the given namespace.

variables.name: oio_ns_mode_worm
variables.descr: Is the NS in a WORM (for Write Once, Read Many --but never delete).

variables.name: main_log_level_reset_delay
variables.descr: Tells how long the verbosity remains higher before being reset to the default, after a SIGUSR1 has been received.

variables.name: oio_m1_client_timeout_common
variables.descr: Sets the timeout to the set of (quick) RPC that query a meta1 service

variables.name: oio_m0_client_timeout_common
variables.descr: Sets the timeout to the set of (quick) RPC that query a meta0 service

variables.name: server_perfdata_enabled
variables.descr: Enable server-side performance data collection.

variables.name: oio_socket_linger_onoff
variables.descr: Set to TRUE to allow the LINGER behavior of TCP sockets, as a default. The connections then end with a normal FIN packet, and go in the TIME_WAIT state for a given delay. Setting to FALSE causes connections to be closed with a RST packet, then avoiding a lot of TCP sockets in the TIME_WAIT state.

variables.name: oio_socket_linger_delay
variables.descr: When socket.linger.enabled is set to TRUE, socket.linger.delat tells how the socket remains in the TIME_WAIT state after the close() has been called.

variables.name: oio_socket_quickack
variables.descr: Should the sockets opened by the application receive the TCP_QUICKACK flag.

variables.name: oio_socket_nodelay
variables.descr: Should the socket to meta~ services receive the TCP_NODELAY flag. When TRUE, it disables the Naggle's algorithm.

variables.name: oio_socket_fastopen
variables.descr: Should the socket to meta~ services use TCP_FASTOPEN flag.

variables.name: oio_client_fake_timeout_threshold
variables.descr: Set the probability of fake timeout failures, in any client RPC to a 'meta' service

variables.name: oio_client_down_avoid
variables.descr: Should an error be raised when the peer is marked down, instead of trying to contact the peer.

variables.name: oio_client_down_shorten
variables.descr: Should the connection timeout be dramatically shortened when talking to a peer that has been reported down. Set to false by default, this is evaluated after the avoidance of those peers.

variables.name: oio_client_cache_errors
variables.descr: Should the client feed a cache with the network errors it encounters, and should those errors be used to prevent RPC to be performed toward 'too-faulty' peers.

variables.name: oio_client_cache_errors_max
variables.descr: Sets the number of faults (on the period given by client.errors_cache.period) beyond which a peer is considered as too faulty to try a new RPC.

variables.name: oio_client_cache_errors_period
variables.descr: Sets the size of the time window used to count the number of network errors.

variables.name: oio_client_timeout_single
variables.descr: Sets the default timeout for unitary (request/response) RPC, without considering the possible redirection.

variables.name: oio_client_timeout_whole
variables.descr: Sets the global timeout of a RPC to e 'meta' service, considering all the possible redirections.

variables.name: oio_client_timeout_connect
variables.descr: Sets the connection timeout, involved in any RPC to a 'meta' service.

variables.name: oio_election_use_timeout_cnx
variables.descr: Sets the connection timeout when ping'ing a peer database. Keep it small. Only used when UDP is disabled.

variables.name: oio_election_use_timeout_req
variables.descr: Sets the global timeout when ping'ing a peer database. Keep it small.

variables.name: oio_election_getvers_timeout_cnx
variables.descr: Sets the connection timeout when exchanging versions between databases replicas.

variables.name: oio_election_getvers_timeout_req
variables.descr: Sets the global timeout when performing a version exchange RPC. Keep it rather small, to let election quickly fail on network troubles. Only used when UDP is disabled.

variables.name: oio_election_replicate_timeout_cnx
variables.descr: Sets the connection timeout sending a replication request.

variables.name: oio_election_replicate_timeout_req
variables.descr: Sets the global timeout when sending a replication RPC, from the current MASTER to a SLAVE

variables.name: oio_election_resync_timeout_cnx
variables.descr: Set the connection timeout during RPC to ask for a SLAVE database to be resync on its MASTER

variables.name: oio_election_resync_timeout_req
variables.descr: Sets the global timeout of a RESYNC request sent to a 'meta' service. Sent to a SLAVE DB, the RESYNC operation involves a RPC from the SLAVE to the MASTER, then a DB dump on the MASTER and restoration on the SLAVE. Thus that operation might be rather long, due to the possibility of network/disk latency/bandwidth, etc. Should be set accordingly with sqliterepo.dumps.timeout

variables.name: sqliterepo_max_rss
variables.descr: Memory size ceiling we try to honor. The check is performed while closing databases. Set to -1 to autodetect the max RSS from the resource limits (see `man getrlimit` for more information) or 0 to disable. The autodetection considers the environment and is not aware of all the processes that could share that environment.

variables.name: sqliterepo_dumps_max
variables.descr: How many concurrent DB dumps may happen in a single process.

variables.name: sqliterepo_dumps_timeout
variables.descr: How long to wait for a concurrent DB dump to finish. Should be set accordingly with sqliterepo.outgoing.timeout.req.resync.

variables.name: sqliterepo_udp_deferred
variables.descr: Should the sendto() of DB_USE be deferred to a thread-pool. Only effective when `oio_udp_allowed` is set. Set to 0 to keep the OS default.

variables.name: sqliterepo_zk_mux_factor
variables.descr: For testing purposes. The value simulates ZK sharding on different connection to the same cluster.

variables.name: sqliterepo_zk_shuffle
variables.descr: Should the synchronism mechanism shuffle the set of URL in the ZK connection string? Set to yes as an attempt to a better balancing of the connections to the nodes of the ZK cluster.

variables.name: sqliterepo_election_lazy_recover
variables.descr: Should the election mecanism try to recreate missing DB?

variables.name: oio_election_lock_alert_delay
variables.descr: Only effective when built in DEBUG mode. Dump the long critical sections around the elections lock, when the lock is held for longer than this threshold (in microseconds).

variables.name: oio_election_period_cond_wait
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, while loop-waiting for a final election status to be reached, this value sets the unit amount of time of eacch unit wait on the lock. Keep this value rather small to avoid waiting for too long, but not too small to avoid dumping CPU cycles in active waiting.

variables.name: oio_election_delay_wait
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the maximum amount of time a worker thread is allowed to wait for an election to get its final status.

variables.name: oio_election_enable_nowait_pending
variables.descr: Check of the election is pending since too long. If it is, don't way for it.

variables.name: oio_election_delay_nowait_pending
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the amount of time spent in an election resolution that will make a worker thread won't wait at all and consider that election is stalled.

variables.name: oio_election_delay_expire_NONE
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the amount of time an election without status will be forgotten

variables.name: oio_election_delay_expire_SLAVE
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the amount of time after which a SLAVE election will drop its status and return to the NONE status. This helps recycling established-but-unused elections, and save Zookeeper nodes.

variables.name: oio_election_delay_expire_MASTER
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the amount of time after which a MASTER election will drop its status and return to the NONE status. This helps recycling established-but-unused elections, and save Zookeeper nodes. Keep this value greater than sqliterepo.election.delay.expire_slave to avoid rotating the master service.

variables.name: oio_election_delay_expire_pending
variables.descr: Sets the amount of time after which a pending election (without any status change) will be reset and return to the NONE status. This helps recovering after a ZooKeeper failure. Should be set between sqliterepo.zk.timeout and sqliterepo.election.wait.delay.

variables.name: oio_election_delay_retry_FAILED
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the amount of time after which a failed election leaves its FAILED status and returns to the NONE status.

variables.name: _page_size
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the page size of all the databases used. This value only has effects on databases created with that value.

variables.name: oio_sqliterepo_cache_kbytes_per_db
variables.descr: Number of kibibytes (kiB) of cache per open DB.

variables.name: oio_sqlx_request_failure_threshold
variables.descr: In testing situations, sets the average ratio of requests failing for a fake reason (from the peer). This helps testing the retrial mechanisms.

variables.name: oio_sqlx_timeout_check_period
variables.descr: In testing situations, sets the average ratio of requests failing for a fake reason (connection timeout). This helps testing the retrial mechanisms and the behavior under strong network split-brain.

variables.name: oio_sqlx_timeout_check_max
variables.descr: In the current sqliterepo repository, sets the maximum amount of time a periodical task may take, while checking for the timeouts on the outbound connections.

variables.name: sqliterepo_allow_master
variables.descr: Allow the role of MASTER in any election.

variables.name: disconnection_rrd_window
variables.descr: Sets the time window to remember the reconnection events, on a ZK connection.

variables.name: disconnection_threshold
variables.descr: Sets the maximum number of reconnections to the ZK that remains acceptable. Beyond that limit, we consider the current service has been disconnected, and that it loast all its nodes.

variables.name: oio_sync_failure_threshold_action
variables.descr: Fake Error rate on synchronism RPC (a.k.a. ZK)

variables.name: _cache_fail_on_heavy_load
variables.descr: Triggers an error when a thread waits for an overloaded database.

variables.name: _cache_alert_on_heavy_load
variables.descr: Triggers an alert when a thread tries to wait for an overloaded database.

variables.name: _cache_max_waiting
variables.descr: Sets how many threads can wait on a single database. All the additional waiters will be denied with any wait attempt.

variables.name: _cache_timeout_open
variables.descr: Sets how long a worker thread accepts for a DB to become available.

variables.name: _cache_period_cond_wait
variables.descr: Sets how long we (unit)wait on the lock around the databases. Keep it small.

variables.name: _cache_heat_threshold
variables.descr: Sets the heat value below which a databse is considered hot

variables.name: _cache_grace_delay_cool
variables.descr: Sets the period after the return to the IDLE/COLD state, during which the recycling is forbidden. 0 means the base won't be decached.

variables.name: _cache_grace_delay_hot
variables.descr: Sets the period after the return to the IDLE/HOT state, during which the recycling is forbidden. 0 means the base won't be decached.

variables.name: sqliterepo_release_size
variables.descr: Sets how many bytes bytes are released when the LEAN request is received by the current 'meta' service.

variables.name: sqliterepo_zk_timeout
variables.descr: Sets the timeout of the zookeeper handle (in the meaning of the zookeeper client library)

variables.name: sqliterepo_repo_max_bases_hard
variables.descr: Sets how many databases can be kept simultaneously open (in use or idle) in the current service. If defined to 0, it is set to 48% of available file descriptors.

variables.name: sqliterepo_repo_max_bases_soft
variables.descr: Sets how many databases can be in use at the same moment in the current service. If defined to 0, it is set to sqliterepo.repo.hard_max.

variables.name: sqliterepo_getvers_attempts
variables.descr: Sets how many versions exchanges are allowed during the journey in the election FSM.

variables.name: sqliterepo_fd_max_active
variables.descr: Maximum number of simultaneous outgoing connections. Set to 0 for an automatic detection (2% of available file descriptors).

variables.name: sqliterepo_fd_min_active
variables.descr: Minimum number of simultaneous outgoing connections.

variables.name: sqliterepo_active_queue_ttl
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximum amount of time a queued DB_USE, DB_GETVERS or DB_PIPEFROM request may remain in the queue. If the message was queued for too long before being sent, it will be dropped. The purpose of such a mechanism is to avoid clogging the queue and the whole election/cache mechanisms with old messages, those messages having already been resent.

variables.name: sqliterepo_election_2master_db
variables.descr: CID of the base to force a double master condition on.

variables.name: sqliterepo_dump_check_type
variables.descr: How to check the database before executing a DB_DUMP request. 0: no check. 1: quick_check (the default). 2: integrity_check.

variables.name: sqliterepo_dump_chunk_size
variables.descr: Size of data chunks when copying a database using the chunked DB_PIPEFROM/DB_DUMP mechanism.

variables.name: sqliterepo_dump_max_size
variables.descr: Maximum size of a database dump. If a base is bigger than this size, it will be refused the synchronous DB_RESTORE mechanism, and will be ansynchronously restored with the DB_DUMP/DB_PIPEFROM mechanism.

variables.name: rdir_fd_per_base
variables.descr: Configure the maximum number of file descriptors allowed to each leveldb database. Set to 0 to autodetermine the value (cf. rdir.fd_reserve). The real value will be clamped at least to 8. Will only be applied on bases opened after the configuration change.

variables.name: rdir_fd_reserve
variables.descr: Configure the total number of file descriptors the leveldb backend may use. Set to 0 to autodetermine the value. Will only be applied on bases opened after the configuration change.

variables.name: server_fd_max_passive
variables.descr: Maximum number of simultaneous incoming connections. Set to 0 for an automatic detection (50% of available file descriptors).

variables.name: oio_udp_allowed
variables.descr: Allow the sqlx client DB_USE RPC to be sent via UDP instead of the default TCP channel.

variables.name: oio_sqlx_lb_refresh_period
variables.descr: In the current sqlx-based service, tells the period (in seconds) at which the service will refresh its load-balancing information.

variables.name: server_event_batch_size
variables.descr: In the network core of a server, how many events do you manage in each call to epoll_wait(). Set to a low value to quickly react on new connections, to an higher value to rather treat established connections. The value is bound to a stack-allocated buffer, keep it rather small.

variables.name: server_accept_batch_size
variables.descr: In the network core, when the server socket wakes the call to epoll_wait(), that value sets the number of subsequent calls to accept(). Setting it to a low value allows to quickly switch to other events (established connection) and can lead to a strvation on the new connections. Setting to a high value might spend too much time in accepting and ease denials of service (with established but idle cnx).

variables.name: server_threadpool_max_unused
variables.descr: In the current server, sets how many threads may remain unused. This value is, in the GLib, common to all the threadpools.

variables.name: server_threadpool_max_idle
variables.descr: In the current server, sets how long a thread can remain unused before considered as idle (and thus to be stopped)

variables.name: server_threadpool_max_tcp
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximum number of threads for the pool responsible for the TCP connections (threading model is one thread per request being managed, and one request at once per TCP connection). Set to 0 for no limit.

variables.name: server_threadpool_max_udp
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximum number of threads for pool responsible for the UDP messages handling. UDP is only used for quick synchronisation messages during MASTER elections. Set ot 0 for no limit.

variables.name: server_cnx_ttl_never
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximum amount of time an established connection is allowed to live when it has no activity at all.

variables.name: server_cnx_ttl_persist
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximum amount of time a connection is allowed to live, since its creation by the accept() call, wheter it presents activity or not.

variables.name: server_cnx_ttl_idle
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximumu amount of time a connection may live without activity since the last activity (i.e. the last reply sent)

variables.name: server_udp_queue_ttl
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximum amount of time a queued UDP frame may remain in the queue. When unqueued, if the message was queued for too long, it will be dropped. The purpose of such a mechanism is to avoid clogging the queue and the whole election/cache mechanisms with old messages, those messages having already been resent.

variables.name: server_udp_queue_maxlen
variables.descr: In the current server, sets the maximum length of the queue for UDP messages. When that number has been reached and a new message arrives, the message will be dropped.

variables.name: server_queue_max_delay
variables.descr: Anti-DDoS counter-mesure. In the current server, sets the maximum amount of time a queued TCP event may remain in the queue. If an event is polled and the thread sees the event stayed longer than that delay, the connection is immediately closed. Keep this value rather high because the connection closing doesn't involve a reply that will help the client to retry with an exponential back-off.

variables.name: server_queue_warn_delay
variables.descr: In the current server, set the time threshold after which a warning is sent when a file descriptor stays longer than that in the queue of the Thread Pool.

variables.name: meta_queue_max_delay
variables.descr: Anti-DDoS counter-mesure. In the current server, sets the maximum amount of time a queued TCP event may remain in the queue. If an event is polled and the thread sees the event stayed longer than that delay, A '503 Unavailabe' error is replied.

variables.name: oio_server_request_failure_threshold
variables.descr: In testing situations, sets the average ratio of requests failing for a fake reason (from the peer). This helps testing the retrial mechanisms.

variables.name: malloc_trim_size_ondemand
variables.descr: Sets how many bytes bytes are released when the LEAN request is received by the current 'meta' service.

variables.name: sqlx_periodic_malloctrim_period
variables.descr: In jiffies, how often the periodic task that calls malloc_trim() is fired.

variables.name: sqlx_periodic_malloctrim_size
variables.descr: Sets how many bytes bytes are released when the LEAN request is received by the current 'meta' service.

variables.name: sqlx_periodic_decache_period
variables.descr: In ticks / jiffies, with approx. 1 tick per second. 0 means never

variables.name: sqlx_periodic_decache_max_bases
variables.descr: How many bases may be decached each time the background task performs its Dance of Death

variables.name: sqlx_periodic_decache_max_delay
variables.descr: How long may the decache routine take

variables.name: sqlx_request_max_run_time
variables.descr: How long a request might take to run on the server side. This value is used to compute a deadline for several waitings (DB cache, manager of elections, etc). Common to all sqliterepo-based services, it might be overriden.

variables.name: oio_proxy_local_prepare
variables.descr: Should the proxy allocate services with a local preference. 0 for no, 1 for only one local service and 2 for a maximum of services in spite of the location constraints. The value 2 is a quirk that should be avoided unless upon exceptional conditon wherein you accept the risk.

variables.name: oio_proxy_location
variables.descr: Specify the OpenIO SDS location of the service.

variables.name: oio_proxy_local_patch
variables.descr: Should the proxy patch the services descriptions to let the caller prefer local services.

variables.name: proxy_request_max_delay
variables.descr: How long a request might take to execute, when no specific deadline has been received. Used to compute a deadline transmitted to backend services, when no timeout is present in the request.

variables.name: oio_proxy_srv_shuffle
variables.descr: Should the proxy shuffle the meta2 addresses before the query, to do a better load-balancing of the requests.

variables.name: oio_proxy_dir_shuffle
variables.descr: Should the proxy shuffle the meta1 addresses before contacting them, thus trying to perform a better fanout of the requests.

variables.name: csurl_refresh_delay
variables.descr: In the proxy, tells the period between the reloadings of the conscience URL, known from the local configuration

variables.name: srvtypes_refresh_delay
variables.descr: In the proxy, tells the period between two refreshes of the known service types, from the conscience

variables.name: nsinfo_refresh_delay
variables.descr: In the proxy, tells the period between two refreshes of the namespace configuration, from the conscience

variables.name: ttl_expire_local_services
variables.descr: In the proxy cache, sets the TTL of a local service

variables.name: ttl_down_services
variables.descr: In the proxy cache, sets the TTL of a service known to be down

variables.name: ttl_known_services
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the TTL of each service already encountered

variables.name: ttl_expire_master_services
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the TTL on each 'known master' entry. That cache is filled each time a redirection to a MASTER occurs, so that we can immediately direct write operation to the service that owns the MASTER copy.

variables.name: lb_downstream_delay
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the period between the refreshes of the load-balancing state from the central conscience.

variables.name: lb_upstream_delay
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the period between two sendings of services states to the conscience.

variables.name: proxy_bulk_max_create_many
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets how many containers can be created at once.

variables.name: proxy_bulk_max_delete_many
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets how many objects can be deleted at once.

variables.name: flag_cache_enabled
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets if any form of caching is allowed. Supersedes the value of resolver.cache.enabled.

variables.name: flag_local_scores
variables.descr: In a proxy, tells if the (ugly-as-hell) quirk that sets the score known from the conscience on the corresponding entries in the cache of services 'known to be local'

variables.name: flag_prefer_master_for_write
variables.descr: In a proxy, upon a write request, should the proxy prefer services known to host the MASTER copy of the DB

variables.name: flag_prefer_master_for_read
variables.descr: In a proxy, upon a read request, should the proxy prefer a service known to host a MASTER copy of the DB. Supersedes proxy.prefer.slave_for_read

variables.name: flag_prefer_slave_for_read
variables.descr: In a proxy, upon a read request, should the proxy prefer a service known to host a SLAVE copy of the DB.

variables.name: flag_force_master
variables.descr: In a proxy, should the process ask the target service (with the help of an option in each RPC) to accept the RPC only if it is MASTER on that DB.

variables.name: proxy_url_path_maxlen
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the maximum length for the URL it receives. This options protects stack allocation for that URL.

variables.name: proxy_timeout_info
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the global timeout for 'info' requests issued

variables.name: proxy_timeout_config
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the global timeout for 'config' requests issued

variables.name: proxy_timeout_stat
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the global timeout for 'stat' requests issued (mostly forwarded for the event-agent)

variables.name: proxy_timeout_conscience
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the global timeout for the RPC to the central cosnience service.

variables.name: proxy_timeout_common
variables.descr: In a proxy, sets the global timeout for all the other RPC issued (not conscience, not stats-related)

variables.name: proxy_enbug_cs_failure_rate
variables.descr: Proxy probability to fail with 503 on a /cs route

variables.name: oio_proxy_request_failure_threshold_alone
variables.descr: Really, do not use this!

variables.name: oio_proxy_request_failure_threshold_first
variables.descr: Really, do not use this!

variables.name: oio_proxy_request_failure_threshold_middle
variables.descr: Really, do not use this!

variables.name: oio_proxy_request_failure_threshold_last
variables.descr: Really, do not use this!

variables.name: meta2_max_versions
variables.descr: Namespace configuration of the max number of versions for a single alias, in a container.

variables.name: oio_socket_proxy_buflen
variables.descr: Advice the libcurl to use that buffer size for the interactions with the proxy. libcurl gives no guaranty to take the advice into account. Set to 0 to let the default. libcurl applies its own range, usually between 1k and 512k.

variables.name: oio_socket_rawx_buflen
variables.descr: Advice the libcurl to use that buffer size for the interactions with the rawx services. libcurl gives no guaranty to take the advice into account. Set to 0 to let the default. libcurl applies its own range, usually between 1k and 512k.

variables.name: oio_sds_default_autocreate
variables.descr: In the current oio-sds client SDK, should the entities be autocreated while accessed for the first time. So, when pushing a content in a container, when this option is set to 'true', the USER and the CONTAINER will be created and configured to the namespace's defaults.

variables.name: oio_sds_no_shuffle
variables.descr: In the current oio-sds client SDK, should the rawx services be shuffled before accessed. This helps ensuring a little load-balancing on the client side.

variables.name: _refresh_major_minor
variables.descr: Sets the minimal amount of time between two refreshes of the list of the major/minor numbers of the known devices, currently mounted on the current host. If the set of mounted file systems doesn't change, keep this value high.

variables.name: _refresh_io_idle
variables.descr: Sets the minimal amount of time between two refreshes of the known IO-idle counters for the current host. Keep this small.

variables.name: oio_sqlx_timeout_req
variables.descr: Sets the timeout for the requests issued to the SQLX services.

variables.name: oio_client_rawx_timeout_cnx
variables.descr: Sets the connection timeout for requests issued to rawx services.

variables.name: oio_client_rawx_timeout_req
variables.descr: Sets the global timeout when uploading a chunk to a rawx service.

variables.name: _refresh_cpu_idle
variables.descr: Sets the miniimal amount of time between two refreshed of the known CPU-idle counters for the current host. Keep this value small.

variables.name: oio_core_http_user_agent
variables.descr: HTTP User-Agent to be used between any C client and the proxy

variables.name: oio_sds_client_version
variables.descr: The version of the sds. It's used to know the expected metadata of a chunk

variables.name: oio_sds_client_patch_metachunk_size
variables.descr: Should the client adapt metachunk size to EC policy parameters? Letting this on will make bigger metachunks, but chunks on storage will stay at normal chunk size. Disabling this option allows clients to do write alignment.

variables.name: oio_chunk_size_minimum
variables.descr: Should the C API adjust the chunk size when below this threshold. Set to 0 for no action

variables.name: oio_chunk_size_maximum
variables.descr: Should the C API adjust the chunk size when over this ceiling. Set to 0 for no action.

variables.name: oio_url_must_be_unicode
variables.descr: Should the object URLs be checked for non-UTF-8 characters? Disable this only if you have trouble reading old objects, uploaded before we check for invalid names.

variables.name: oio_lb_weighted_random_attempts
variables.descr: How many times shall we try to select a service using a weighted random algorithm, before switching to the shuffled selection. Increase this if you observe too many choices of low-score services while high-score services are available.

variables.name: oio_lb_writer_lock_alert_delay
variables.descr: Dump the time spent while holding the global writer lock, when the lock is held for longer than this threshold (in microseconds).

variables.name: oio_lb_allow_distance_bypass
variables.descr: Compare the number of items to select to the number of items available at the current location level, and decide if it is desirable to bypass or slacken the time-consuming distance checks. Disable this if you detect too many situations where distance between selected items could have been bigger.

variables.name: oio_lb_random_chunk_ids
variables.descr: Generate random, 64 bytes long chunk IDs. If set to false, the chunk IDs will be generated from the container and object names, object version and storage policy, and chunk position.
